com.sri.kernel.srml
Class SRMLManager

java.lang.Object
  com.sri.kernel.srml.SRMLManager
public class SRMLManager
extends java.lang.Object

This provides functionality to retrieve a new SRMLParser and to register and unergister SRML Elements. It also privdes a the base SRML element, "srml".

Version:
1.5
Author:
Joseph Monti, Smart Robots

Nested Class Summary
 class SRMLManager.SRMLSrml
          This SRML Element is the base SRML element required when writing SRML.
 
Constructor Summary
SRMLManager(Logger logger)
          This initializes the list of SRML elements and adds the element "srml".
 
Method Summary
 SRMLParser newSRMLParser(java.lang.String s)
          This will return a new SRML Parser initialized with the existing list of SRML Elements, a logger, and the SRML to be parsed.
 boolean registerElement(SRMLElement el)
          This will register a new SRML Element, assuming the element does not alredy exist.
 boolean unregisterElement(java.lang.String name)
          This will unregister an SRML element with the given name.

Constructor Detail

SRMLManager

public SRMLManager(Logger logger)
This initializes the list of SRML elements and adds the element "srml".

Parameters:

Method Detail

newSRMLParser

public SRMLParser newSRMLParser(java.lang.String s)
                         throws java.io.IOException
This will return a new SRML Parser initialized with the existing list of SRML Elements, a logger, and the SRML to be parsed.

Parameters:
s - The SRML to be parsed by the new parser.
Returns:
The new SRML Parser created.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

registerElement

public boolean registerElement(SRMLElement el)
This will register a new SRML Element, assuming the element does not alredy exist.

Parameters:
el - The SRML Element to register.
Returns:
true if the element was registered, false otherwise.

unregisterElement

public boolean unregisterElement(java.lang.String name)
This will unregister an SRML element with the given name.

Parameters:
name - The name of the SRML element to be removed.
Returns:
true if the element was removed, false otherwise.
